traitDescription: earliest observation within a year, given as yearday
latest observation within a year, given as yearday
number of months during which flying individuals are observed
extendedDescription: Weeks and days are expressed as fractions of an an average month (i.e. 30 days)

traitDescription: strategies used for protection
extendedDescription: Any animal behaviour allowing it to escape from a danger or a nocive situation and to survive

traitDescription: strategies used for dispersal
extendedDescription: Does not include disperal of offspring or reproductive cells

traitDescription: dispersal ability relative to other species within the same taxonomic group
potential range of dispersal using active dispersal strategies
potential range of dispersal using passive dispersal strategies
locomotion by means of wings
stratum of the nest location
extendedDescription: Vegetation includes low and dead vegetation

traitDescription: coniferous tree species are used for hibernation
individuals usually occur in spatial clusters

suggestedFactorLevels: Subsocial / Solitary but social / Communal / Quasisocial / Semisocial / Eusocial
traitDescription: degree to which individuals in an animal population tend to associate in social groups and form cooperative societies
extendedDescription: Any behavioural or ecological features that increase interindividual attraction, and tolerance.

traitDescription: first and last month of a year when individuals can be observed
extendedDescription: First and last month are abbreviated to three letters based on english names. Months are connected with "-" for continous time spans or separated with "." for interupted time spans.

traitDescription: number of months during individuals are active
extendedDescription: Weeks and days are expressed as fractions of an an average month (i.e. 30 days)

traitDescription: strategies for egg protection
extendedDescription: Parasitims includes cuckoldry. Internal protection applies to viviparous strategies

traitDescription: strategy against climatic adversity, such as low temperature or drought
protection of eggs by physical means
extendedDescription: Includes protection outside the parent and inside the parend

traitDescription: position of the pupa within the nest
extendedDescription: Usually applies to burrows or tree holes

traitDescription: average elevation above sea level at which individuals have been observed
highest elevation above sea level at which individuals have been observed
lowest elevation above sea level at which individuals have been observed
species distribution along an environmental factor describing the microhabitat dimension of the ecological niche
extendedDescription: microhabitat is defined as the smallest part of the environment that substitutes as habitat

traitDescription: humidity conditions in which individuals occur
extendedDescription: Humidity can be measured in different strata, e.g. in the soil or in the air

traitDescription: average amount of oxygen in the waterbody at which individuals were observed
maximum amount of oxygen in the waterbody at which individuals were observed
minimum amount of oxygen in the waterbody at which individuals were observed
average temperature under which individuals can survive
extendedDescription: Temperature measured in the prefered microhabitat

traitDescription: maximum temperature under which individuals can survive
extendedDescription: Temperature measured in the prefered microhabitat

traitDescription: minimum temperature under which individuals can survive
extendedDescription: Temperature measured in the prefered microhabitat

traitDescription: average temperature under which individuals are active
extendedDescription: Temperature measured in the prefered microhabitat

traitDescription: maximum temperature under which individuals are active
extendedDescription: Temperature measured in the prefered microhabitat

traitDescription: minimum temperature under which individuals are active
extendedDescription: Temperature measured in the prefered microhabitat

traitDescription: average temperature under which individuals reproduce
extendedDescription: Temperature measured in the prefered microhabitat

traitDescription: maximum temperature under which individuals reproduce
extendedDescription: Temperature measured in the prefered microhabitat

traitDescription: minimum temperature under which individuals reproduce
extendedDescription: Temperature measured in the prefered microhabitat

traitDescription: average temperature under which juveniles develop into adults
extendedDescription: Temperature measured in the prefered microhabitat

traitDescription: maximum temperature under which juveniles develop into adults
extendedDescription: Temperature measured in the prefered microhabitat

traitDescription: minimum temperature under which juveniles develop into adults
extendedDescription: Temperature measured in the prefered microhabitat

traitDescription: occurence of individuals is restricted to a certain habitat
extendedDescription: Any level of habitat specialization should be indicated here.

traitDescription: occurence of individuals is restricted to a certain altitude class
extendedDescription: planar: to 400m/kollin: 400-800m/montan: 800-1.500/subalpin: 1.500-2.300/alpin: 2.300-2.700/nival: above 2.700

traitDescription: vertical distribution of habitat
extendedDescription: Stratum in which individuals are usually observed. Second prefered habitat is given in brackets. S:soil/g:ground/h:herb-layer/t:shrub & tree_layer

traitDescription: habitats where occurrence of individuals is most common
extendedDescription: Land cover classes are based on CORINE land cover classes

traitDescription: individuals only occur in forested areas
individuals only occur in grasslands
occurence of individuals is restricted to habitats with a specific state of naturalness
extendedDescription: naturalness ranges from climax (most natural) to artificial

traitDescription: species distribution is defined by an environmental factor
extendedDescription: factors describe needs (…phil) or relationships (…biont) or tolerances (…tolerant). azido: acid/chromo: colours/copro: faeces/halo: salt/helio: light/hygro: humidity/hylo: wood/kreno: springs/myceto: fungus/myrmec: ants/necro: carcass/osmo: smell/petro: bolder/pholeo: darkness/psammo: sand/rheo: currents/sapro: decomposition/silico: pebbles/thermo: temperature/tixo: touch/troglo: cave/tyro: bogs_swamps/xero: dryness
Source: Koch (1989) Die Käfer Mitteleuropas - Ökologie. Goecke & Evers Verlag. ISBN 3-87263-037-7

traitDescription: climate zone(s) in which individuals are observed
extendedDescription: Climate zone definition follows Köppen with five main groups: A (tropical)/ B (dry) / C (temperate) / D (continental) / E (polar)

traitDescription: number of habitat types where individuals can be observed
extendedDescription: Obiquitos species are assigned 0, strict specialists are assigned 1.

traitDescription: species is dependent on pre-anthropogenic conditions (e.g. "Urwald-Reliktarten")
species is obligat dependent on deadwood
extendedDescription: Dependence needs to be critical for survival or reproduction

traitDescription: average value of mass water content in soil at which individuals were observed
maximum value of mass water content in soil at which individuals were observed
minimum value of mass water content in soil at which individuals were observed
average relative humidity in the air at which individuals were observed
maximum relative humidity in the air at which individuals were observed
minimum relative humidity in the air at which individuals were observed
individuals occur in the same or different habitats throughout the year
extendedDescription: monoroph: only one stratum/allaxoroph: stratum change/xeroph: several strata at the same time/monochor: at specific locations within one stratum/allaxochor: change of location/xerochor: several locations within one stratum/homotop: complete life-cycle in one habitat/heterotop: life-cycle in different habitats
Source: Koch (1989) Die Käfer Mitteleuropas - Ökologie. Goecke & Evers Verlag. ISBN 3-87263-037-7

traitDescription: feeding guild of the species
extendedDescription: h: herbivor/ c: carnivor/ f: fungivores/ d: detritivor/ o: omnivores

traitDescription: feeding guild of the species in its adult stage
extendedDescription: h: herbivor/ c: carnivor/ f: fungivores/ d: detritivor/ o: omnivores

traitDescription: feeding guild of the species in its juvenile stage
extendedDescription: h: herbivor/ c: carnivor/ f: fungivores/ d: detritivor/ o: omnivores

traitDescription: mode of aquiring the nutrients
extendedDescription: e: extraintestinal/ c: chewing/ s:sucking

traitDescription: mode of aquiring the nutrients during larval stage
extendedDescription: e: extraintestinal/ c: chewing/ s:sucking

traitDescription: width of host specialization
extendedDescription: m: monophag (on one species or genus of host)/ o: oligophag (on one family or subfamily of host)/ p: poliphag (on more than one family of host)

traitDescription: width of host specialization in juveniles
extendedDescription: m: monophag (on one species or genus of host)/ o: oligophag (on one family or subfamily of host)/ p: poliphag (on more than one family of host)

traitDescription: tissue from which nutrients are aquired
extendedDescription: m: mesophyll-cells / p: phloem / r: reproductive organs / x: xylem / se: ripe seeds / bl: blood / bo: bones / f: fatty tissue / ms: muscular tissue / w: whole organism

traitDescription: plant parts on which herbivorous species feed
extendedDescription: l: leaves / r: reproductive organs / ro: roots / s: stem / se: ripe seeds

traitDescription: tissue from which nutrients are aquired during the juvenil stage
extendedDescription: m: mesophyll-cells / p: phloem / r: reproductive organs / x: xylem / se: ripe seeds / bl: blood / bo: bones / f: fatty tissue / ms: muscular tissue / w: whole organism

traitDescription: plant parts on which herbivorous species feed during juvenile stage
extendedDescription: l: leaves / r: reproductive organs / ro: roots / s: stem / se: ripe seeds

traitDescription: details on endophagously living larvae
extendedDescription: gl: gall-inducer leaves / g: gall-inducer reproductive organs / gs: gall-inducer stems / ml: miner leaves / mr: miner reproductive organs / ms: miner stem / mro: miner roots

traitDescription: general trophic level
trophic level within the foodweb
extendedDescription: levels are counted as -1: destruent /0: producers /1: first level consumer / 2: second level consumer

traitDescription: strategy to aquire food items
type of trap constructed to catch prey
scientific name or group of hosts or prey
number of different known host or prey species
strategy for transfer of genes
